name: Photoshop Intermediate SYDNEY Saturday October 19th 2013
description:
BOOKINGS NOW OPEN HERE - 

www.theschool.com.au

Do you want to take your Photoshop skills further?
Once you have completed the Photoshop for Bloggers and beginners workshop, this intermediate class enables you to come back and build on those skills you mastered. There are some more difficult techniques that we will cover, and they reinforce the knowledge you have gained while extending your skills even further. We will do one of the things that Photoshoppers love to do but often can’t quite get right - creating digital collages. This involves going into photographs and digitally cutting them out from their background, so that the object sits on a transparent space. Once we have cut out the objects, we will arrange them together on the one page in Photoshop in exactly the way you want them to look. This can involve filters, colour correction, scaling, layers and lots of easy, effective tools to add to your toolbox. If you loved the first class and want to consolidate your skills, this course will offer the same easy step-by-step instructions and fun, laid back atmosphere of the first workshop.

Workshop includes - Morning tea, yummy lunch and class notes.

What to bring - Your own laptop with Photoshop CC installed. If you don't own it yet, you can download the free 30 day trial. Please ensure it is  installed and working before the workshop! 

Directions - You can park on Dunning or Morley Avenue and walk to southern side of 85 Dunning Avenue. Look around the garden for the giant spot painted on the giant roller door. Entry is through the clear door to the left.

You can take the 343, 309, 310, M20 and L09 bus routes.

Green Square train station is a 1.5 km walk away. Head south from Green Square towards O'Riordan Street, turn left into O'Riordan Street, right into Botany Road and left into Morley Avenue. At the roundabout take the first exit onto Dunning Avenue.

name: InDesign Basics NEWCASTLE
description:
Would you like to get a quick start in using InDesign? You can use this powerful software for all of your publishing and layout needs - in fact it was built to design publications, from the smallest brochure to the largest ebook, magazine or physical tome. In this interactive workshop, you will learn what the best strategies are for you and your particular medium. Source your own drawings, photos and illustrations to create layouts and designs with text, headings and multiple pages. The perfect way to integrate all your writing and images in one seamless program!

Class notes provided, BYO laptop and download the trial version of InDesign CC so that it is ready to be used on the day.

name: Photoshop for Bloggers AUCKLAND Saturday 2nd November 2013
description:
Always wanted to use Photoshop but don’t know where to start? This full day workshop will teach you how to use Photoshop for your blog banners, buttons and photos. You’ll learn how to combine photos, add text to images, and make your photos lighter, brighter and better! Photoshop is a powerful program but it can be very overwhelming! This class concentrates on fun techniques that you will be able to apply to your blog straight away. Blogging just got a whole lot more beautiful!

If you want to get a quick start in meaningful and useful Photoshop techniques, this is the course for you. By doing step-by-step tasks, you will gain confidence and understand how to use the tools at your disposal.

This is a hands-on practical workshop, and you will work on tasks and exercises throughout the day with your teacher right there to help with any points you get stuck on. You will have a workbook that contains all the class notes, and lots of resources to use after the class. 

After this class, you will be able to create your own banners and buttons, combine text and imagery, manipulate photos, and upload them to your blog or website.

Workshop includes - Morning tea, yummy lunch and class notes.

What to bring - Your own laptop with Photoshop CC installed. If you don't own it yet, you can download the free 30 day trial. Please ensure it is  installed and working before the workshop! 

BOOKINGS NOW OPEN AT www.theschool.com.au

name: MELBOURNE WORKSHOP
description:

This is a hands-on practical workshop, and you will work on tasks and exercises throughout the day with your teacher right there to help with any points you get stuck on. You will have a workbook that contains all the class notes, and lots of resources to use after the class.

name: Blog Design Basics SYDNEY Saturday July 20th 2013
description:
Have you always wanted to start a blog? Do you need to give your existing blog some TLC so that it reflects the style and colour that you want it to? Great blog design is based on a few simple ideas, and there are definite rules that you need to know to make your blog design work. The look and feel of your blog gives your audience a reason to read and explore more about your work. Whether you use or want to use Blogger, Tumblr, Wordpress or any other platform, your design skills will improve by using the techniques covered in this class. 

We will look at the tools available for you to manipulate your images, the pros and cons of the different platforms that are out there, and show you how to create a professional looking blog using tried and tested methods. This workshop will focus on making your ideas a reality, with creative and practical steps to make it happen!

Saturday July 20th 2013
1pm-4pm
BYO laptop is optional (but may help you formulate your ideas)

Location - 
The School by Megan Morton
85 Dunning Avenue 
Rosebery NSW

name: My Own Private Workshop
description: Learn in your own environment and at your own pace! Simone will come to your office or home, and tailor a learning package that suits just what you want to know - without all the extra baggage. Perhaps there are a few of you that want to get together to work on your new skills. If you are starting a new business or a new blog this is the option for you.  Use the contact form on the left to enquire about dates and availability, or request a date in the notes section of the checkout. From $660 for up to 3 people.

name: Build Your Own Online Store NEWCASTLE
description:
Do you want your own online shop? This workshop will teach you the step-by-step process of building an online store to sell your products quickly, easily and safely. The payment system is paypal, which is a trusted way for people to pay you with their credit card or from a bank account. You can customise your logo, banner and photographs. You can write descriptions, add pages and links, and change listings instantly. Best of all, at the end of this workshop you will have an online store that we can send live at the end of the class (if you are ready to go!) And you will go home with the knowledge and skills to update and maintain your products where and when you want to. 

Pre-requisites:
1. You need to have a basic/good understanding of computers and email. After all, your customers will be able to purchase from you and you will receive all orders via email!
2. You need to bring your own laptop with any images and text you may want to upload on the day.
3. You need to have a Paypal account set up and working before the workshop. 

Workshop includes - Morning tea, yummy lunch and class notes.

Location - Simone's studio in Wickham, Newcastle

name: CUSTOM DESIGN Banners, Buttons and Backgrounds
description:
OH YES !! and due to popular demand ......... no you don't have to do it yourself !!!!

Send an email if you have a specific element you need created - of course I am happy to help! Starting from $149
